 2.2 - ENOUGH TIME
NO TIMING(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

Timing is not an essential part of the event or activity presented by the
content, except for non-interactive synchronized media and real-time events. 

These websites...

Provide users enough time to read and use content.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
Rather than calibrating an on-line test using a time limit, the test is
calibrated based on scores when users have no time limits. Iâ€™d like to know a
little more
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/no-timing.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 05 October 2023 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2023/REC-WCAG22-20231005/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
